title: Grade 11 -  World Views and Aspirations of First Nations, Métis, and Inuit Communities in Canada NBV3E (2019)
subject: First Nations, Métis, and Inuit Studies

document.title: Grade 11 -  World Views and Aspirations of First Nations, Métis, and Inuit Communities in Canada NBV3E (2019)

0338718CE1E34C7698FEF2B6D292B7C9.description: interpret and explain the goals of several different social initiatives to support First Nations, Métis, and Inuit aspirations

FA6847DF9BE44184BF6808599A3C902B.description: identify and describe some aspirations that First Nations, Métis, and Inuit individuals and organizations characterize as important for communities, for Canada, and for global society

237776D777D24287812CE1BF50EDCDB4.description: Aspirations and Social Action: demonstrate an understanding of how key First Nations, Métis, and Inuit aspirations for communities, for Canada, and for global society reflect traditional and contemporary beliefs and values, and analyse the role of social action in supporting those goals

FABDCC9D068B4E2C85DFFFBB9DF17595.description: analyse some judicial/legal actions in Canada intended to affirm truth, reconciliation, and renewal related to Aboriginal title, treaty rights, and nation-to-nation relationships to determine the key stakeholders and processes involved in these actions

0C6FDFB997AF4926BED8CDAE236A98F2.description: analyse some government policies and actions in Canada intended to affirm truth, reconciliation, and renewal related to decolonization to determine the key commitments of these policies/actions and identify some results

86CFCBE65F604D4F9301B6D5EDACE68B.description: identify and describe several different ways in which efforts to promote First Nations, Métis, and Inuit environmental knowledge and perspectives have contributed to truth, reconciliation, and renewal

32EF10E422D348478B22E0658EFC23EF.description: make and explain some connections between First Nations, Métis, and Inuit cultural observances/events and the goals of truth, reconciliation, and renewal

A87E8997EE5C4EBD91F67C6BE2CD664C.description: Truth, Reconciliation, and Renewal: demonstrate an understanding of how building recognition and respect for First Nations, Métis, and Inuit knowledge, world views, and aspirations contributes to truth, reconciliation, and renewed nation-to-nation relationships

EF2FBE86F6E44F94B769A9A9CDF60B70.description: identify several different programs and initiatives to reclaim a place for First Nations, Métis, and Inuit beliefs, values, and customs in education in Canada

7554AFD4A2104593A6C62EDE47B62977.description: analyse some strategies to integrate traditional knowledge and customs into contemporary life for First Nations, Métis, and Inuit individuals and communities to identify a few benefits and challenges related to these efforts

33ED768AE0B8404E956F9EEC64B40A29.description: explain the function of some individual roles associated with First Nations, Métis, and Inuit beliefs, values, and customs

3E4C96EE1CF6467B8F28A651E0AF2989.description: Reclaiming Traditional Beliefs, Values, and Customs: demonstrate an understanding of how individuals, families, institutions, and communities are reclaiming a place for First Nations, Métis, and Inuit beliefs, values, and customs in contemporary life

60E845097044464BAC4D9350A05E601F.description: analyse some forms and uses of contemporary technology, media, and popular culture

344160798D154CC1BC35355535297CBE.description: identify and describe some First Nations, Métis, and Inuit initiatives to address language loss

50E2BB759B0D468F82114B4FD55AF6B5.description: identify and describe some First Nations, Métis, and Inuit initiatives to assert community control over local economic development and land use

7EF64A047B5349738B11A555375F43EB.description: identify and describe some initiatives to raise awareness of the continuing impact of colonialist policies in Canada

D31942109C7541559DD8175FB20C69E1.description: demonstrate an understanding of the key goals of decolonization and resilience in the context of social change

85E67BC1896742A8B7E4C690ED228C1E.description: Decolonization, Resilience, and Social Change: demonstrate an understanding of the key concepts and goals of decolonization and resilience, analysing various strategies to raise awareness of the impact of colonialist policies and to sustain First Nations, Métis, and Inuit world views, aspirations, and actions in the context of social change

3659FFEB079242A7953A1ECC583D4934.description: make and explain inferences about the use of political and judicial systems in Canada to enforce colonialist approaches to the ownership, development, and management of land and natural resources

6A12F9879A9D46D2BFC91CCE4BA62049.description: explain some ways in which the concept of assimilation has been put into practice in Canada, and assess various consequences for First Nations, Métis, and Inuit individuals, communities, world views, and aspirations

AE029664AFA544AA98DEA54840899E6A.description: demonstrate an understanding of the key concepts associated with colonialism, describing how these concepts were put into practice in what would be called Canada

BB8E7D53E8414F40950417413EA7B100.description: Colonialism and Colonization: demonstrate an understanding of the concept of colonialism, and of the past and present impact of colonization and related government policies in Canada

5CE86BD2591041A39BB0419A981F23DB.description: design an initiative to build awareness of First Nations, Métis, and Inuit cultures and realities within the school community

6639B75C87F14ACDAD3641C420A37EF8.description: explain how some policies regulating public institutions in Canada have challenged and continue to challenge Indigenous cultural practices

E070D84BCA084CAF97F747D1E7A15CD6.description: analyse some First Nations, Métis, and Inuit cultural works in terms of what they communicate about cultural identity and/or cross-cultural interaction

5B39C937F76444CFAB4304996EC52C97.description: identify some cultural awareness skills and strategies

39382C140B9142088808CF53BB607FF8.description: Cultural Awareness Skills and Strategies: use cultural awareness skills and strategies appropriately when exploring First Nations, Métis, and Inuit ways of knowing, world views, and contributions to society

37BC70BD40D74E539C8A9909801A7585.description: analyse some Indigenous ceremonies and other traditional practices in terms of how these practices help define individual and/or collective roles and responsibilities within a world view

A8A931E30A9940409182CBD98965693F.description: identify several different locations that are significant in the world views of various First Nations, Métis, and Inuit communities, and explain the beliefs and/or values that have been and continue to be associated with those sites

EA6AA69D8E3C4F00BF0B5BEB56DF1766.description: describe and compare the roles of several different significant figures associated with First Nations, Métis, and Inuit belief systems

BEE3FCC2D6E442788C834F29D1EEA30F.description: make and explain inferences about how the use of First Nations, Métis, and Inuit languages sustains cultural values and identities

2490A9C3322E4C69AB17F839580D8FC7.description: identify some common elements of First Nations, Métis, and Inuit beliefs and customs

63EA93CDEF464B54BAB3DA6A67383989.description: First Nations, Métis, and Inuit World Views: demonstrate an understanding of how language, culture, and the relationship between people and place shape and reflect First Nations, Métis, and Inuit world views, identifying key elements of the beliefs, values, and customs associated with diverse cultures

D0D9DA95F3EE40DB88D07F262F20E86C.description: explain how several different aspects of daily life and common aspirations in Canada are shaped by and reflect specific beliefs and values

A9E7E52E465B4D188A5E01295D5A41C8.description: compare their own and at least one other world view to identify some common purposes and functions of a belief system

DA72C3887FF248C18E08CFDD28D2D52E.description: identify several different elements of a world view or belief system

D73031A64F5046FDA598630D081E0D56.description: The Concept of World View: demonstrate an understanding of the elements, purposes, and functions of a world view or belief system, and explore the role of world view in daily life in Canada

C987F45321C54BB9B2E4AE02DC954AAD.description: Understanding and Respecting World Views and Cultural Diversity

BBCF527CEE6B47EB8FB3642B1E634802.description: demonstrate an understanding of the general research and inquiry process by reflecting on and evaluating their own research, inquiry, and communication skills, while respecting Indigenous knowledge and ways of knowing

E5420395950F4EA79C6A78D8F61640DD.description: clearly communicate the results of their inquiries (e.g., write coherently, organize ideas logically, use language conventions properly), and follow documentation conventions for acknowledging sources

3E1C1BDF7659477EA3ED09C5EB728396.description: use correctly terms and phrases related to various First Nations, Métis, and Inuit world views and experiences

77A12A99209B4BB3B8DE558E63B32E4F.description: use an appropriate format (e.g., oral presentation, graph, brochure, flyer, poster, multimedia presentation, web page, spreadsheet) to communicate the results of their research and inquiry effectively for a specific purpose and audience

BFCA259835E74706A8AABBFD823CC67E.description: Communicating and Reflecting: communicate the results of their research and inquiry clearly and effectively, and reflect on and evaluate their research, inquiry, and communication skills

92521BD76A524283892F97C338C1CEBF.description: demonstrate academic honesty by documenting the sources of all information generated through research

A43E3E402BB64811B1D9C13A683FBD1E.description: analyse and interpret research information (e.g., compare information provided in written documents, oral stories, and interviews; determine whether common themes arise in different sources)

431652BE926842A1AB9E28974524EE71.description: record and organize information and key ideas using a variety of formats

F86B3C7121294D8AB6142D0AE4E1C961.description: record and organize information and key ideas using a variety of formats

73935482BE834F808ADE93AFFF4AA61A.description: assess various aspects of information gathered from Indigenous and non-Indigenous knowledge sources, using general research criteria

DEB0705936F943F5A9B3A46F5CB30A24.description: Processing Information: assess, record, analyse, and synthesize information gathered through research and inquiry, respecting Indigenous knowledge and ways of knowing

7589D6A8057D4D6EADCEBD04382B67E0.description: based on preliminary research, formulate a hypothesis, thesis statement, or critical question for each investigation, and use it to focus their inquiry

1CE2B69AFEDE4F70806A12AFEDC93D1F.description: locate and select information relevant to their investigations from a variety of primary and/or secondary sources, including Indigenous knowledge sources

427C026CE81A4B12A850ED8E6E4BB63D.description: create appropriate research plans to investigate their selected topics (e.g., outline purpose and method; identify sources of information; develop research tools such as surveys, questionnaires, or interviews), ensuring that their plans apply the principles of intent, reciprocity, and respect and that they acknowledge Indigenous ways of knowing and related protocols

E7878034AFE74F08B7B25FF3D6C3DBD2.description: Investigating: create research plans, and locate and select information relevant to their chosen topics from a variety of sources, using appropriate research and inquiry methods and respecting Indigenous knowledge and ways of knowing

4C56E472AFA240CFABC13E18CB49E45F.description: formulate effective questions to guide their research and inquiry

7664455CFAC34B4E8C3B98BC0C83FE41.description: identify key concepts related to their selected topics (e.g., through listening, discussion, brain- storming, the use of visual organizers)

77BDD33362A64E14B0DCC538E6693465.description: explore a variety of themes related to the knowledge, world views, and aspirations that shape the actions of First Nations, Métis, and Inuit individuals and communities

FBF6E29E06B247399198747A4C0892C7.description: Exploring: explore topics related to the knowledge, world views, and aspirations that shape the actions of First Nations, Métis, and Inuit individuals and communities, identifying key concepts and formulating critical questions to guide their research and inquiry

34E3CD193CCA497DBEE3E84094B978D6.description: First Nations, Métis, and Inuit Studies
